content.rendered:
The sun is shining and the water is rising on all our rivers throughout the grand state of Colorado! Now is the time to awaken your adventurous side and take a whitewater rafting trip anywhere in Colorado. The Arkansas River, which is home to the Brown’s Canyon, the Numbers, and Pine Creek is running fast and fun at well over 1,200 CFS (cubic feet per second). The Clear Creek, located in historic Idaho Springs is running rapidly at just above 800 CFS. Tread carefully though, due to high water levels the rivers are moving faster and some rapids become more technical to maneuver so make sure to book the right trip for you and your group’s ability level.

Looking for a scenic float trip or a casual afternoon on the river? Look no further then our Kremmling location, which features a fun family float tour on the scenic Colorado. With the river running at just above 400 CFS, the Colorado Float trip is the perfect family getaway, rafting through the heart of the Rocky Mountains. With Colorado being hit with an abundance of snow late in the season, the rivers are running rapidly from the excess snow melt, creating many exciting trips! Running at such speeds, this is the prime time to participate in some whitewater rafting. Whether you are looking for a lazy float down the river, or a multi-day, exhilarating excursion, Arkansas Valley Adventures has it all!
